title.rendered: 16 Best Things To Do In New Delhi

content.rendered:
India is a land where distinctive cultures and religions beautifully blend together. Similarly, the country’s capital, New Delhi, has a vast culture and diversity, with different religions, languages, and clothes. It’s the most incredible place to visit for a unique and colorful cultural experience. Luxury hotels and restaurants in New Delhi offer quite an experience for affluent travelers. In a city where the future and the past collide each day, there’s something for everyone. Read on to discover the best things to do in New Delhi!

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in New Delhi

Exciting Outdoor Activities in New Delhi

1. Lotus Temple

The Lotus Temple is a work of art in its own right. The entire edifice is built entirely of marble, from top to bottom. The temple is open to people of all cultures and is one of the best places to visit in New Delhi to meditate and pray.

Plan your visit
Website

2. Humayun’s Tomb

In the sixteenth century, this monument was built as a memorial for the Mughal emperor Humayun. This UNESCO World Heritage site now includes marble monuments of a number of other Mughal kings. Truly one of the best places to visit in New Delhi to witness exquisite Persian design.

Website

3. Rashtrapati Bhavan

The Rashtrapati Bhavan, the President of India’s official home, is a magnificent palace structure with about 400 rooms. The beautiful Mughal Gardens, which draw a significant number of local and international visitors, are the pride of the presidential residence here.

Plan your visit

Related: 5 New York Hiking Trails to Add to Your Traveling Bucket-list

Don’t Miss Out On The Sports Scene in New Delhi

1. Enjoy a heritage walk

The city of Delhi has a rich and checkered past, with century-old monuments coexisting with modern infrastructure. Taking a series of Heritage walks is one of the best things to do in New Delhi.

Website

2. Go boating at the Old Fort

The Old Fort, or Purana Qila as it is known locally, offers a charming boating area nestled among the ruins and is bordered by the Delhi Zoo. Every day except Monday, this is a wonderful spot to unwind against the backdrop of the ancient fort.

Know more

3. Play Escape Games at Mystery Rooms

Among the best things to do in New Delhi is to experience a real time escape adventure. Here, escape games are played in mystery rooms with the only goal of escaping. It involves entering a themed area, cracking codes, and solving puzzles before the 60-minute timer runs out.

Website

Related: 5 Ways To Save Money For Your Next Vacation

Must Visit Museums in New Delhi

1. Nehru Planetarium

Space science buffs, this one’s for you! Observing and studying various astronomical phenomena with telescopes is one of the best things to do in New Delhi. The planetarium has evolved into a scientific research center for astronomy, as well as a venue for astronomical gatherings and lectures.

Website

2. International Dolls Museum

The International Dolls Museum in Delhi is home to over 6500 exhibits from over 85 nations. The museum is divided into two sections: one for dolls from India and other Asian nations, and the other for dolls from the United States, Australia, Europe, and New Zealand.

Plan your visit

3. National Science Centre

This is a great, family-friendly attraction that has been named one of the best places to visit in New Delhi. Learn about everything from interstellar physics to dinosaurs at the National Science Centre.

Plan your visit

Related: How to Make Money for the Holidays – Pandemic Edition

Cultural Places To Visit in New Delhi

1. India Gate

A visit to this 42m high iconic and historical monument is among the best things to do in New Delhi. Dedicated to the remembrance of the soldiers who lost their lives in the Afghan war, it’s not only an educational experience but also a photographer’s joy.

Know more

2. Qutub Minar

One of the best things to do in New Delhi is to go to Qutub Minar. It’s a well-known UNESCO world heritage monument and among the most popular places to visit in New Delhi. This tower, which stands 240 feet tall, was built in 1192 by Qutb-ud-din Aibak, the first ruler of Delhi. This minaret bears the name of its builder.

Know more

3. Akshardham Temple

Akshardham Temple is undoubtedly one of the best places to visit in New Delhi. This complex holds more than a temple. It also has a water show, a theme garden, hall of values, IMAX film of Swaminarayan’s life, cultural boat ride and much more. We have no doubt that its architecture will leave you in awe.

  • Timings: 9:30 am to 6:30 pm
Website
Plan Your Visit

4. Old Delhi

There’s no end to the best things to do in New Delhi! Head to Old Delhi, a place distant from the loud modernism of Gurgaon that has been around for millennia. It’s here that you’ll discover beautiful historical monuments like the Red Fort and the Jama Masjid Mosque, and it’s also where most visitors start their city excursions.

Know more

Related: The Eco-Life: How to Minimize Expenses While on Vacation

Explore Popular Bars, Shopping Centers & Restaurants in New Delhi

1. The Chatter House

The Chatter House’s dark green and timber ambiance will take you back in time. This is one of Delhi’s most traditional bars. Moreover, watching sports on large screens is among the best things to do in New Delhi to experience life like a true Delhiite!

Menu

2. Connaught Place

Connaught Place is famous for its Georgian-style architecture. Locally known as CP, it’s a commercial, shopping, and entertainment hotspot in Delhi. The region was designed by the British as a focal point for colonial Delhi, and it remains so today. Locals unwind in the marketplaces, shopping districts, and restaurants in New Delhi’s CP.

Know more

3. Farzi Cafe

This cafe is known for its attractive presentation of fusion dishes and a very well-organized bar. It’s also among the best restaurants in New Delhi when it comes to flavors and quality.

Website
